segments.text: I see the boy on that wobbly stool, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s reaching for cookies like he doesn’t have a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her turn, like this is a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes, completely oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is, like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip, and the boy is going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just watching, like she’s waiting for the inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone is going to get hurt, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just chaotic, but everyone is acting like it’s fine.
segments.speaker: PAR
